intro: Lepachys tagetes, commonly known as Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and ornamental planting. The flowers are not only visually striking but also have historical uses in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent.
